required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Endoscopic Ultrasound-guided Fine Needle Aspiration of Solid Masses: Histological and Immunohistochemical Evaluation
clinical_study.official_title: Endoscopic Ultrasound-guided Fine Needle Aspiration of Solid Masses: Histological and Immunohistochemical Evaluation

brief_summary.textblock: The aim of this retrospective single center study was to evaluate the clinical utility of histological and immunohistochemical analyses of specimens obtained by endoscopic ultrasound-guided fine needle aspiration (EUS-FNA).

primary_outcome.measure: the diagnostic accuracy of cytology, histology, and combined analysis of specimens obtained by EUS-FNA for pancreatic or peripancreatic solid masses
primary_outcome.time_frame: at least 6 months after surgery or clinical follow up
primary_outcome.description: The first, pre-op checked each diagnostic accuracy of cytology, histology, and combined analysis by EUS-FNA. and then, finaly diagnosis following surgery or clinical follow up for at least 6 months was re-check with diagnosic accuracy of cytology, histology, and combined analysis pre-diagnosed by EUS-FNA

intervention.description: tissue samples were harvested from 116 patients undergoing EUS-FNA of solid masses for cytologic smear and histological analysis.

biospec_descr.textblock: cytopathologic result acquired by endoscopic ultrasound-guided fine needle aspiration (EUS-FNA).

study_pop.textblock: patients who underwent EUS-FNA to evaluate solid pancreatic or peripancreatic lesions from January 2009 to July 2010 in Samsung Medical Center,

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- We retrospectively reviewed medical records of patients who underwent EUS-FNA to evaluate solid pancreatic or peripancreatic lesions from January 2009 to July 2010
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients with unavailable data
